content: I’m Jamie Pask, Web Engineer from Wales (next to England).
Currently living in Los Angeles, working as a freelance web engineer seeking opportunities to collaborate with lively, forward thinking brands. Feel free to
if you’re looking to create some awesome projects together.

blocks.content: The classic ‘British guy meets American girl on a study abroad trip’ story. One thing led to another and here I am, across the world, developing incredible websites for amazing people.

At the time of meeting my future wife, I had graduated from Cardiff Metropolitan University with a Bachelor of Science degree in Architectural Design & Technology, and was working as a Technician in a well respected, local Architecture firm.

Task automation and software enchantments became commonplace and led to a self education in all things software. On a 3 month trip to Los Angeles in 2015, I developed my very first simple, web based portfolio and have been consistently researching web technologies ever since. I took the dive into a full career change in 2019, working as a freelance developer for various clients.

content: to have worked on some exciting projects with these awesome brands.

blocks.company: LEAD DEVELOPER | TECHYSCOUTS | LOS ANGELES, CA
blocks.content:
Working as a freelance developer for Techyscouts, my day to day ranges from fixing legacy code bugs, to producing new sites using the latest technologies. Here are some of the interesting roles I’ve taken on at the company:

  • Coordinated web development, deployment and maintenance techniques for collaborative work. In particular, creating local environments within Docker containers, incorporating CI/CD processes with GIT hooks and documenting preferred workflows for future projects.
  • Built custom Wordpress themes, Shopify themes and apps using modern build tools, specifically Webpack and Gulp, to incorporate current web technologies and improve maintainability.
  • Produced technical solutions for a variety of reasons, ranging from UI to hosting issues.
  • Consumed a range of third party API’s. For instance, I have utilized Loyalty Lion’s API to generate custom CSV files, exporting and storing output for local download within an S3 bucket.
  • Replicated Figma/Photoshop/XD files to pixel accuracy.
  • Adhered to coding standards through consistent research and incorporating linters into my workflow.

I’ve also been contracted by a few companies around the world with a focus on building sites with NextJS, Wordpress and Shopify. Here are some of the roles taken on during this time:

  • Partnered on an ongoing basis with brands and individuals seeking website creation, existing site enhancements or technical solutions.
  • Connected with clients via Zoom, Slack and other communication tools to report project progress.
  • Incorporated Shopify into a pre-existing NextJS application by consuming the Storefront API. The project involved pulling Shopify product data for displaying and filtering, creating a functional AJAX cart with Redux state management and ensuring a robust checkout system.
  • Built emailing templates through Mailchimp and other CRM’s.
